Content: Had the oppurtunity to go to one of her shows with my friend and was one very memorable experience

Taylor Swift really knows how to put on a show from the moment I entered the stadium I was being called cute and pretty and trading friendship Bracelets and as soon as I got to my seats I heard music and I loved how she put on music while we waited my quick review on Gracie she was amazing go see her for sure! I loved it now back to Taylor it was crazy how kind she is I talked to us in a genuine way and she’s so funny but he music is so good it means a lot to me that I got to go and it’s such a magical experience so if you have the change to go see Taylor Swift go for sure she is just amazing words can’t explain how good she is!

Taylor Swift delivered an absolutely magical performance! From the moment she stepped on stage, the entire stadium was on fire with excitement. She took us on a journey through all her eras—singing hits from Fearless to 1989, Lover, and even her latest songs. Every single detail, from the stunning visuals to the flawless choreography, was perfection.

Taylor’s connection with her fans is unreal. She spoke to the crowd like we were old friends, sharing stories behind her songs and even surprising us with acoustic versions of some deep cuts. Her vocals were incredible, and the emotional energy in the room gave me chills. You could feel the love and passion she pours into every performance.

The crowd was singing every word, the light-up bracelets synced with the music, and the whole night felt like a dream. If you ever get the chance to see Taylor Swift live—DO NOT miss it. It’s more than just a concert; it’s an experience you’ll never forget!

Words are truly not enough to fully encapsulate the energy, excitement and impressiveness that was The Eras Tour. Having seen the show on 3 separate occasions (Seattle and Vancouver x2), I never grew tired of walking through those stadium gates; the eager concert goers trading friendship bracelets with everyone they saw, the sparkling outfits that you know took months and months of preparation, the Swift-themed menu items, the spontaneous singalongs...and this was all before Taylor took the stage. The show itself felt more like a fever dream than a concert. The talent, coordination, composure and athleticism required to put on such a production is something that will be studied in high regard for years to come. The set flowed immaculately and went by in a blink, despite it being 3h long. Between the inside jokes, traditions old and new and overall classic Taylor Swift dazzling energy, this was a tour made for the fans, and it did not disappoint. Truly one of the best shows I have ever had the privilege of seeing. I will remember this tour all too well in the most enchanting way. Long Live the Eras Tour <3

From the long lines to the awesome shows, Taylor puts on is absolutely breathtaking. I’ve been following Taylor since she started out in 2005. She was an inspiration to me then and she’s an inspiration to my granddaughter now.!!! no matter how much money I spend, I’ll keep spending it to watch her shows!! I’ve been going to her concerts for a very long time and I plan on keeping it up. Her shows will be a family tradition and hopefully we’ll keep passing it down. Your shows are amazing Taylor keep it up. I love your outfits. I love your beautiful smile and so does my granddaughter Harley. We love you oh so much and will always be here and be your biggest fan. Thank you for coming to Tennessee!!! my granddaughter, and I drove from Alabama to Tennessee to see the ERA TOUR  AND BOY WHAT A SHOW BEAUTIFUL BEAUTIFUL JUST AS I EXPECTED IF NOT MORE! Loved the surprise songs you rock Taylor

I probably ruined concerts for myself and that’s okay. Taylor put on one of the best concerts ever, this will be in history books. Between getting the two surprise songs I really wanted and basically guessed , getting to see glow because Travis was there, watching Gracie, all the beautiful outfits, I can’t tell you how much better this could’ve been because it exceeded my expectations. Thank you Taylor for coming to Indy 💕

The Eras Tour has been one of the best experiences of my live (and I haven‘t been a Swiftie in the at first). 
Speaking of the Swifties: The overall experience around the actuall show is just lovely and wholesome! Everyone is happy and wants to have a good time. 
The world would be a better place if it would be more like a TS show with the Swifties around. 

More than 3hrs pure joy and fun with a fast-track thru Taylor‘s career.

Seeing The Eras Tour live was an incredible experience! Taylor and her team of dancers, signers, band, and stage crew are so incredibly talented and dedicated to putting on an amazing show!! Going to The Eras Tour was definitely the best day of my life and such an indescribable experience! It was so special to see Taylor perform for over 3 hours and to give us such powerful emotion and captivating choreography and costumes. Her costumes were so shiny and bedazzled it was almost impossible to not look at her the entire show, anytime I tried to look at the stage or screen my eyes were always brought back to Taylor in her glittering prime.

The show was everything one could hope it would be. Entry into and security for BC Place was smooth and professional, had no problems getting drink, food, merch, and leaving afterwards. The systems put into place to move folks through every aspect were clearly well considered. Taylor and her crew were just incredible. Words cannot describe how immensely amazing the entire evening was.

All I can say is wow!!! My city definitely rolled out all the things for the last shows of The Eras Tour. I ended up getting a ticket to N1 from a complete stranger in Detroit. She gifted her behind the stage ticket to a lucky Swiftie🫶 

Getting into gate C was a little crazy as we had to cross over to Rogers Arena and then finally cross the street. The line went all the way back to Pacific. Although once in line it only took about 20 min to get in. 

I didn’t bother with merch as I went to Canada Place a couple of days before. Once I got to my seat I was pleasantly surprised that they had put screens up for the behind the stage seats. 

The overall vibes were awesome and the show was amazing. I’m still in awe and pinching myself that I got to go in the end. Great job BC Place and Vancouver!

Long Live The Eras Tour💕

All I can say is wow!!! My city definitely rolled out all the things for the last shows of The Eras Tour. I ended up getting a ticket to N1 from a complete stranger in Detroit. She gifted her behind the stage ticket to a lucky Swiftie🫶 

Getting into gate C was a little crazy as we had to cross over to Rogers Arena and then finally cross the street. The line went all the way back to Pacific. Although once in line it only took about 20 min to get in. 

I didn’t bother with merch as I went to Canada Place a couple of days before. Once I got to my seat I was pleasantly surprised that they had put screens up for the behind the stage seats. 

The overall vibes were awesome and the show was amazing. I’m still in awe and pinching myself that I got to go in the end. Great job BC Place and Vancouver!

Long Live The Eras Tour💕

Untouchable is what The Eras Tour is and was! I had the time of my life fighting dragons with everyone that was there in person, and via the grainy livestreams. While I will always always wish that many a bot didn’t get their hands on tickets to resell via third party sites, I can’t help but appreciate that Taylor and her team also offered “no view” seats for the final weekend. That said, our seats still had an incredible view with the added bonus of seeing the entire tour crew in a behind the scenes style way. We sang, shook it off, cried, cheered (1-2-3 LGB), and left glitter on the floor after the party.

It's Taylor Swift. It's the Eras Tour. So of course the show itself was incredible!!! I also saw her at Levi Stadium last summer and loved it then, too.
The reason for only 4 out of 5 stars: Unfortunately for the Vancouver show, I was in section 455, and there was a light structure on the floor with pyrotechnics on top that totally blocked center stage and the center of the big screen. The only other screens were relatively small and at the top of BC Place. Because of this, me and those around me missed out on a lot. Having traveled from CA and having paid a lot for my ticket, this was pretty disappointing.

Taylor Swift’s The Eras Tour is, without a doubt, one of the most extraordinary and iconic live performances of our time. It is a once-in-a-lifetime experience that blends musical history, emotional storytelling, and unparalleled stagecraft into an unforgettable night. In terms of sheer spectacle and artistry, The Eras Tour is a benchmark in concert history. It’s the kind of event that leaves you thinking, “I was there.” Witnessing Taylor Swift in her prime, commanding the stage with grace, passion, and charm, is an experience that will stay with you forever. Whether you're a die-hard Swiftie or a newcomer, it’s impossible to leave the show without feeling like you've just witnessed one of the most incredible performances ever to grace the stage. Taylor Swift’s The Eras Tour is not just a concert—it’s an event. An event that celebrates the power of music, the joy of shared experiences, and the artistry of one of the most talented musicians of our time.

The best concert I have ever attended! Taylor Swift went above and beyond for her fans, playing 3 1/2 hours.  Going to a TS show is probably the most positive experience a person could have.  Everyone is happy, no judgment, people singing along, smiling and having the best times of their life.  I am grateful I attended and will never forget this experience with my daughter and my friends.  She is truly an Icon.  Thank you Taylor for the ERAS tour.  Your fans will never forget it!

Taylor’s Eras Tour was a cinematic experience. The choreography, lights, songs were all carefully thought out. I only got tickets to one show and I’m grateful to have had that opportunity! The only down side for me was the man in front of me. He was too tall for my own good. At one point he had shifted down his row blocking my view of the entire stage during The Tortured Poets Department set. I didn’t say anything because his wife was having the time of her life and I didn’t want to take the chance of souring their experience. Next time, I think I’ll try and go for front row of whatever section I can get.

My daughter and I came from L
Prince George for the last show of her tour and we experienced a seminal moment in both our lives. Everyone that we ran into from fans to staffers, security and venders we so unbelievably warm and friendly!  I was so happy, myself, that I got to dance (and hard) to some of my favourites: ‘Cruel Summer’, ‘Lover’, ‘Delicate’, ‘Are You Ready for It’ and ‘Don’t Blame Me’  and then ‘Willow’ and ‘Betty’ later on. I love Taylor Swift so I wasn’t too surprised how much I was going to enjoy her.  The real ‘magic’, for me was getting to experience the raw, unbridled emotion that poured out from my daughter when Taylor played her ‘surprise’ songs, starting with ‘New Romantics’. Seeing my daughter, Jorja, exasperated trying to catch her breath as she realized what Taylor was playing and seeing the tears stream down her face, without remission, made me lose all control and I cried inconsolably.  The bonds that were forged between dad and daughter over the entire weekend were made possible because of the flawless show that we were able to attend.  Well done Ticketmaster as well for making it so easy to redeem our on -line tickets. 
Can’t wait to do another Ticketmaster event , hopefully sooner than later; 
Sincerely Ryan McMaster, Prince George, BC

The bonds that were forged between dad and daughter over the entire weekend were made possible because of the flawless show that we were able to attend.  Well done Ticketmaster as well for making it so easy to redeem our on -line tickets. 
Can’t wait to do another Ticketmaster event , hopefully sooner than later; 
Sincerely Ryan McMaster, Prince George, BC

We attended the last Taylor Swift Concert in Vancouver. It was a "great show"but, it felt more like a stage-show on Broadway - very scripted. Taylor Swift appeared like she was going through the motions, and there was no personal engagement with the crowd. Her comments were the same across the three nights in Vancouver. No comment about it being her last show, rather a general comment about the end of Eras Tour. It felt like the "elephant in the room"within the stadium - the last show of the Eras Tour, but no acknowledgement of this. This seemed like a running commentary as we left the stadium.

The show lacked the spontaneity and involvement of other concerts. This was dissapointing. She appeared understandably done with the tour. But, perhaps it's lengthiness was too much. I would have been happy with less of a production and more of the great singer she is.

Finding the words to encapsulate my eras tour experience seems impossible but I’m going to do my best because I feel like I have to say something. Like everyone else, I tried to get tickets for this tour at every opportunity. My friends and I were willing to go anywhere at any time as long as we could get tickets, but it didn’t work out over and over again. One last time I registered for verified fan when the Vancouver dates were released. Once again I got waitlisted, but while on a work trip to Toronto I got a text in the airport that I was cleared from the waitlist and suddenly the moment I was chasing for over a year was right in front of me. I surprised my best friend with these tickets for her birthday 3 weeks after I bought them with custom friendship bracelets with the show date and location. Fast forward 1 year and 29 days and there we are in Vancouver for the last ever eras tour show. Everything worked out exactly the way it was meant to and I feel that in my soul. I’ll never get over being about to be part of the cultural movement that was the eras tour, from talking my about every detail of the show with my friends, going to see the movie in theaters, trading friendship bracelets with girls at brunch before the show to spending hours and hours and hours bedazzling a body suit to wear to the show, to finally experiencing it live with my best friends. Thank you Taylor Swift, for existing in the same timeline as me and for bringing the magic and joy of girlhood to an all time high and giving us all the confidence and self worth to exist as our truest and most authentic selves. I laughed, I cried (a lot), and embraced the women in my life I love so much.  And I can confidently say, I have been changed for good.

getting into the arena was a bit difficult. there were long snaky lines throughout many parts of downtown vancouver. while i understand a large amount of people have to get through a small opening at the same time, i felt this could’ve been handled better, especially since it was the third (and final) night. for instance, a guard was directing foot traffic through cones and caution tape, while stating that sometimes the other gate (gate h) opens up, but she had no idea when it would. when i was about to the front of gate b, gate h suddenly opened, causing a slew of concert goers to rush over and disrupt the coned off line. there were also no lights around this part of the stadium, causing a bit of a safety issue as there are many stairs. i felt the overall foot traffic could’ve been directed better, as this was the final night in the city with the same amount of crowd. i completely understand that many concert goers were uninformed, standing around, causing and incredible inconvenience for those actively fighting to get into a line, but a stronger presence of direction could’ve resolved this issue. for instance, an email explaining gate information, times, and closures would’ve been helpful for those who have never visited the city. clear ‘start’ signs to show where lines begin would’ve also been helpful since may were traveling from all street directions. an appropriate amount of gates open to better control the influx of foot traffic also would’ve been confident. overall, staff did a great job of trying to control the crowd, but a little more guidance would’ve been helpful. thank you to all who made this experience possible!

I had behind the stage seating with no obstructions. The screen was right there which was nice, but since there was one screen and it had been programmed to mostly show the backgrounds and supporting graphics for each of the eras, we often didn’t get to see what Taylor was doing. The Jumbotron screen facing us was blank, which I thought was too bad because it would’ve helped us be able to see more of her performance while still seeing the backgrounds.

Cannot say enough about the show, it was a once in a lifetime experience!  That said, I know that we were some of the lucky ones able to get tickets locally.  The majority of the crowd was people who had travel to attend.  I wish there were more available for locals to buy and attend. Taylor’s concert was the most amazing concert I have ever attended, and I have seen many legends over the decades, or Eras of my life. Taylor began on time and never stopped entertaining us for 3 1/2 hours. Even when she was doing quick costume changes we were entertained with amazing dancers and beautiful graphics. The huge screen let everyone feel like we were much closer. It was such an energetic performance, and Taylor made us feel so special for turning out to see her, she loves performing and appreciates her fans. The enthusiasm of the crowd was so contagious, everyone was happy, friendly and kind. An amazing,  positive evening I’ll always remember. What a STAR!

Taylor Swift gives her all in her performances. A true artist. The venue was good although the offerings of food and drinks were not great. And after receiving a note that bags had to be a certain size- I brought that size of bag that fit just my phone and credit cards. As we tried to go through the gate I was accosted 5 times by people insisting my bag was too big and would have to check it for $40. I was clearly not happy.  Thankfully the concert was perfect!

We had seen Taylor at the beginning of the eras tour and wanted to see her again after she released TTPD.   That part was fantastic.  However, we learned that our show (the very last show of the tour)  was 20 minutes shorter than the night before and also didnt include a Gracie Abrams duet like the night before.  In fact, my daughter noticed she didnt speak to the crowd very much and she was right.  I understand Taylor was exhausted Im sure at the end of eras, as she should be, but it felt like she was already gone.  That being said, the Venue and Vancouver were amazing.  They put a Taylor lit sign and friendahip bracelet installation all over the city.  What a wonderful surprise!

The past almost two years have been the great for a reason, OUR beloved eras tour. I have attended each of Taylor Swift’s tours through her career, but this one just superseded them all. Attending the tour closing night was an emotional experience, but as they say all good things must come to an end. Thank you to our queen for being a superhuman being and giving us everything since March of 2023. I dare anyone to, “Try and come for her job,” to paraphrase this genius. I love you Taylor Swift and I was lucky to experience this tour so many times. It was indeed the end of the ERAS, but the start of an age💜

Absolutely phenomenal show! The entire sadium was ablaze with pure joy, passion and kindness!! I will never regret going to a Taylor Swift concert but I would have regretted not getting to experience the once in a lifetime Era’s Tour!! So thankful I was able to get a ticket through a friend to see the 3 1/2 hour performance Taylor gave night after night for a year and a half! She never does anything half way but she far exceeded herself this time! Just an amazing, spectacular show! Her voice, her personality, the detailed performances for each song, the digital displays on the screens and floors, the light up bracelets we are given that flash different colors to the music, her beautiful outfits, her amazing dancers, her talented band, the vibes!! 100/100 Best experience ever and a night I will never forget!

First, I would like to tell that the concert was perfect. Taylor is an amazing singer and her and her team’s performance was impeccable. However, I am very disappointed with Ticketmaster sales, because my family and I couldn’t be able to join any queue. Although there are a bunch of people who can get tickets and resale those for extremely overpriced costs. It is very unfair. Since I thought that Ticketmaster’s register fans policy was to avoid resales and scams.

We paid extra for floor tickets. Unfortunately, it was really challenging to see anything at all due to the lay out of the floor. Additionally, many people were allowing their children to stand on the seats which made it near impossible to see the show. There were people with signs stating not to stand on the seats walking up and down the isles but nothing was enforced and there were several children standing on seats. I had children with me as well and wouldn’t allow them on the seats which made them pretty upset seeing all the other kids do it, and they couldn’t even see the screen due to others standing on the seats.

This night was sparkling! No one puts on a show like my girl Taylor! So grateful to be in the Swiftie Community! I was lucky enough to go to the first show on March 17th and the 2nd to last on December 7th and it was truly on honor to witness first hand the growth of the show! Thank you Taylor!

I had floor seats in section B5 on the FINAL NIGHT OF THE ERAS TOUR. Row 4- the dream seats. Center stage. And the professional filmographer almost completely blocked the concert for most of us in seats 6-10. (He was lined up with the main walkway). The only time we got a clear view of the stage is when the filmographer dropped down as Taylor came downstage.

Most of our section were short girls, and we couldn't even see the big screen a lot of the time. Some gave up and just sat down. 

Overall, the Taylor was excellent and thankfully there was a screen kind of overhead that I could look up to for most of the concert! It was just a bummer to have those seats and then not have them be as good as they should have been

It was an amazing concert. Glad I went. I don't like it when talent lets the crowd cheer or screech for them for a long time without stopping it. I don't need to go deaf. The wrist lights were an amazing idea. The opening act needed a better sound check. I could not make out the lyrics of her songs. I wasn't the only one around me that couldn't make out what she was saying. While waiting for the concert to start I thought they could of done better with the Taylor footage. I couldn't hear a lot of what she was saying and I did not want to see her in a mask. She looked beautiful and I loved all of her costume changes.

I've listened to Taylor Swift since she released her debut album and subsequent albums since. I called myself a casual Swiftie at best or simply a listener, however, until I went to Santa Clara N2. The Eras Tour profoundly changed my life. You don't realise how many events of your personal or professional life are intertwined and intersect with Swift's works until the opening of her concert, finding yourself overwhelmed with a surge of emotions abruptly. It reminds you she's not simply someone on the other side of your headphones.

I typically only go to concerts at small jazz venues. Do you wave? That feels weird. I guess this is why she wrote TTPD, a masterpiece of her lived experiences—the crowd was chanting "more". When she tours again, I'll dance my feelings out again, be done with school (I decided to go back during her Speak Now set at Santa Clara), and remember this beautiful end of a 149-concert run in Vancouver with my friends.

Taylor Swift’s The Eras Tour in Vancouver was an absolute blast! It wasn’t just a concert, it was a magical journey through her music. Taylor’s energy and generosity were on full display, and fans left feeling like they had a special connection with her. She poured her heart, soul, and every last note into the show, and it was truly unforgettable.

For over three hours, Swift commanded the stage with all her might. Whether she was pouring her heart out on the piano or leading a dance party, she had us all on our feet. Her voice was strong and powerful throughout, even though the show was super intense. Few artists can keep up with such a high-energy performance while still showing emotion in every song. Swift also made sure to shine a spotlight on her band, dancers, and crew. She showed them how much she appreciated their hard work and dedication, which made it clear that The Eras Tour wasn’t just about her success; it was a celebration of everyone involved. 

Overall, an incredible show, an incredible night. 10/10

The absolute joy and happiness the show brought to my heart cannot be described with words. I was a fan of Taylor’s before seeing her I concert, but now I can call myself a certified S W I F T I E!! She (and her back up performers) are absolutely brilliant. The production was out of this world. But my favorite was being packed in a stadium with beautiful women (and men) everywhere. All were there for the same reason - no permission was needed to dance like on one in watching, become their authentic selves, and scream Taylor’s music at the top of their lungs in complete expression. This show is an experience that I will never forget. Love you TS! Thank you for everything you represent in this world.

This show was by far the most amazing concert I have ever been to and I have been to quite a lot. The work and effort they put into it shows big time. It’s just amazing the amount of work her and her team put into this show. I went to Toronto N2 and it was euphoric, truly. I have been a fan for Taylor since I was a young girl and I unfortunately have never had the chance to make it to one of her shows, so going to this one with every era included was a dream come true. To experience every album this woman has given us and to go through her discography like this was truly out of this world. No artist does it like her. 3.5 hour show that she is on stage performing!? With no breaks!? Insane. She is so talented. Her live vocals are beautiful. The way she interacts with the fans and makes everyone feel seen even the ones in the nose bleeds is like no other. You can truly tell she loves and cherishes her fans. The production, the visuals, her dancers, her band, and TAYLOR were just so great and amazing and put on one hell of a show. It’s hard to put into words how great it really was. Thank you, Taylor and to everyone who made this tour what it was. I can’t believe it’s over after 2 years, I kind of don’t know what to do with myself now lol.

taylor, as always, was amazing. what wasn’t amazing was the process of obtaining tickets. verified fan is just another loop real fans have to jump through AND still compete with scalpers. not only this, but when additional tickets did drop, we’d either be let in to buy them but no tickets would be remaining, or we wouldn’t be let in at all!! too much of a fight for tickets led to an unreasonable demand. for a tour this big, it should have been dealt with better

We saw the Dec. 6th show in Vancouver and it did not disappoint! It was my daughter and my first time seeing Taylor Swift and she is hands down the best performer ever! The entire show was amazing! Cannot wait to hopefully see her again in the future, and actually get tickets from Ticketmaster so we don’t pay an arm and a leg!

We flew to Austria in August and were devastated we did not get to see her, but grateful everyone was safe! Didn’t think it was possible to see her, but we managed to pull it together for this show to finish what we started, and so thankful it all worked out! Love you Taylor!

Taylor Swift was one of the best concerts I have seen! It was myself and my 15 year old daughter’s first time seeing her.

We had so much fun! The stage, costumes, music, performances by Taylor and her backup singers and dancers were amazing! Taylor and her crew had so much energy! I loved how the stage had different projections on it for different songs and the middle platform stage moved up and down during the show. 

I wish I could go again!

Meeting other fans and exchanging friendship bracelets with them was so much fun.

Taylor Swift knows how to put on a great concert! From her gorgeous outfits, awesome sets, catchy choreography to her talented guitar and piano skills, Taylor is a true superstar! We sang and danced to so many songs from all of her Eras and the energy of the crowd was magical. Her acoustic set really showcased her musical and lyrical talent. Taylor Swift will never “go out of style!” This concert was my daughter and I’s “wildest dreams” come true and was the “best day”. Ending with the perfect song and fireworks, Karma! Thank you Taylor! Looking forward to the next era!

The Eras Tour was hands down the best concert that I ever went to. Taylor takes you through each era of her music and even if you are seeing her for the first time or have seen her for multiple times it feels as if you have been apart of her musical journey since the beginning. Her tour production is out of this world and her vocals sound amazing live! Truly an incredible night that I did not want to end. If ever given the chance to see her perform live I fully recommend buying a ticket. I’m already looking forward to the next time she goes on tour.

I don't even know where to begin! This was the most phenomenal concert experience of my life. 
From the second Taylor stepped on stage until the final bows, the entire crowd was absolutely captivated.
Every single detail was perfect. The theatrics were mind-blowing, the costumes were stunning, and the way the setlist flowed through all her musical eras was genius. The light show and pyrotechnics were out of this world, and the wristbands that lit up and synced with the music created the most magical atmosphere.
Taylor's energy was infectious! She poured her heart and soul into every song for 3.5 hours straight. It was an emotional rollercoaster, filled with joy, nostalgia, and pure magic. This is a night I will cherish forever.
If you ever get the chance to see Taylor Swift live, DO IT! You won't regret it.

Every single detail was perfect. The theatrics were mind-blowing, the costumes were stunning, and the way the setlist flowed through all her musical eras was genius. The light show and pyrotechnics were out of this world, and the wristbands that lit up and synced with the music created the most magical atmosphere.
Taylor's energy was infectious! She poured her heart and soul into every song for 3.5 hours straight. It was an emotional rollercoaster, filled with joy, nostalgia, and pure magic. This is a night I will cherish forever.
If you ever get the chance to see Taylor Swift live, DO IT! You won't regret it.

Taylor Swift puts on an amazing concert. FIVE STARS for the concert itself. 2 STARS for the VIP tickets.  I thought the VIP tickets that we bought for a big upcharge did not include half the things it said it would. There was no VIP entrance, No dedicated merchandise section, the seats we had were not cushioned and actually had an obstructed view. There was a camera tower that blocked the center of the stage. I think I would have been just as happy paying $200 for regular seats.  All we got was a tote bag, some posters and postcards. We got a VIP badge that did nothing for us as well. I felt taken advantage of.  The seats did not correlate to what was portrayed when we bought the tickets. The concert itself was absolutely amazing 🤩
Taylor Swiftvwad amazing. Worth every penny! BC Stadium is by far he WORST venue I have seen a show at. All the concrete surfaces create terrible reverb/echos with the treble/high end.

While the concert was amazing, the events leading up to it were not. I, along with friends and family, registered to be selected to purchase TS tickets on Ticketmaster back in August 2023. There were 12 accounts all together, and NOT ONE OF US, got access to the sale. I was able to buy tickets off of my cousin TWO DAYS before the concert. She managed to get tickets on a drop TM did after the stage was set up. It was very sad to see so many tickets go to resellers for profit. I tried for 16 months to get face value tickets!!!
The Eras tour absolutely did rise up to all the hype! From Taylor herself, to the dancers, the set, the choreography it was a masterclass second to none show!
The Eras tour absolutely did rise up to all the hype! From Taylor herself, to the dancers, the set, the choreography it was a masterclass second to none show!

We had a phenomenal time at the night 1 Taylor Swift concert in Vancouver. The energy in the city was incredible from the moment we arrived. The venue was great from staff to set up. Event staff were happy, warm and friendly. They brought in a lot of (clean!) port-o-Johns so the lines were never crazy. 
The concert was spectacular. Everything about her show is meticulously planned and Taylor is clearly in a league of her own. Her dancers, band and backup singers are also just fabulous. The crowd was so amped and loud, but she sounded clear and great. I would go again and again…. I hope I get another opportunity to see her.

After taking a few days to reflect; I have come to the conclusion that Taylor Swift is a true visionary, and a pioneer, a beacon for girls and women world wide. Having attend her Eras Tour, not once, but twice, I think should speak for itself. I have never once been in a single place where nearly 65000 people- not just women/girls, were so unapologetic about their happiness and were loud in expressing it. I am so thankful for Taylor creating these safe spaces for everyone to get together, dance, since, and love together. So many memories created. Eras tour, you were so impactful for over 10.1 million people who have had the pleasure and immense luck in attending you. Cannot wait to see what Taylor decides to do next.

Seriously, after 18 months of anticipation and waitlist disappointment, I got myself a ticket. I could not miss this. It’s Woodstock for swifties. It was amazing. She is a sight to see, if you have a bucket list throw a Taylor Swift concert on it. Everyone who attends these concerts is there for the right reasons! Meeting best friends, parents with kids, and adorable couples everywhere was just the most easy breezy social interaction I’ve had this year. Venue staff at BC place were helpful and cheery through the night. It really was a night we will remember for the rest of our lives. Thank you Taylor & crew for your dedication to The Eras Tour <3

Taylor Swift was fantastic! The arena was electric with high energy and anticipation as the clock ticked down to the opening. I had tears & goose bumps when she appeared to open her show. I watched the fans around me, of all ages, singing along. I watched the lights throughout the audience and stage, and it was incredible how it all worked together, so impressive! The coreography, dancers, singers were great and they looked like they were having fun. 
Most impressive was Taylor's performance! Over 3 hours of, singing, dancing, playing guitar and piano... high energy & emotion throughout. It was an experience I will never forget!

The Eras Tour was an absolutely magnificent experience. It was so much more than just a concert. I had the time of my life trading friendship bracelets, chatting with Swifties, interacting with all of the venue staff, and watching this once-in-a-lifetime performance by the most talented artist. Taylor is so sincere and genuine, and it's obvious that she puts everything she has into putting on the best show for her audience. I've been to many concerts, but I've never been a part of something as special as the Eras Tour. Taylor's band and dancers were incredible. The stage itself was such a marvel. The entire production of this show was remarkable. I feel very lucky to have been able to witness Taylor Swift perform. It had, indeed, been a long time coming, and I'll remember it for the rest of my life...all too well. :)

Where do I begin? The ERAS tour was phenomenal on so many levels! The camaraderie of the fans, the atmosphere in Toronto, and of course, Taylor herself were amazing! I've never experienced anything like that in my entire life. I truly got lucky when I applied for a code last summer but I had no idea what I was in for. 

To experience love, respect and connection on that level is absolutely beautiful. This weekend reminded me of what the world can be like, and that we all have the power to make that change happen.

We paid over $1,000 in the presale for each VIP ticket. For other legs of the tour, VIP came with actual perks that seemed to make it worthwhile. All we received was a box of low cost merch (posters, stickers, a tote bag), but did not receive what is normal for VIP (early entry, access to merch, VIP concession area). The logistics cause us to spend extra time in lines, miss getting exclusive merch etc. Felt like a bait and switch.  Concert was great though and Rogers Centre staff members were very friendly.

The Eras Tour has surpassed the categorization as a “concert” and drifted into the zeitgeist of “cultural wave.” The positivity, kinship, and community that Ms Swift has curated will go down in history. We will be telling our grandchildren about the electricity in the air before she took the stage, the dozens of friendship bracelet trades, and the kind comments from strangers about the beautiful our homemade outfits were for the show. Never have I ever felt safer in a crowd than at this event. It was the honour of a lifetime to hear songs from my youth alongside swifties of all ages. It is an understatement to say that we have been changed for the better after night 6 of the Toronto show. Truly a transformative evening for all in attendance, Taylor put on an exhilarating marathon performance. It is a shame how difficult it was for fans to be in attendance, how the lottery favoured a few and was the detriment to the majority of her fans. What a lost opportunity to improve the ticket buying system, a disappointment to the true music fans who missed out on building community together inside the venue. I can only hope that we learn from our missteps and keep fans top of mind moving forward.

I can only hope that we learn from our missteps and keep fans top of mind moving forward.

The Eras Tour has surpassed the categorization as a “concert” and drifted into the zeitgeist of “cultural wave.” The positivity, kinship, and community that Ms Swift has curated will go down in history. We will be telling our grandchildren about the electricity in the air before she took the stage, the dozens of friendship bracelet trades, and the kind comments from strangers about the beautiful our homemade outfits were for the show. Never have I ever felt safer in a crowd than at this event. It was the honour of a lifetime to hear songs from my youth alongside swifties of all ages. It is an understatement to say that we have been changed for the better after night 6 of the Toronto show. Truly a transformative evening for all in attendance, Taylor put on an exhilarating marathon performance. It is a shame how difficult it was for fans to be in attendance, how the lottery favoured a few and was the detriment to the majority of her fans. What a lost opportunity to improve the ticket buying system, a disappointment to the true music fans who missed out on building community together inside the venue. I can only hope that we learn from our missteps and keep fans top of mind moving forward.

This concert was the absolute best!! The outfits, the light-up bracelets, the flames, the fireworks, the props, just everything was perfect! I can't wait until the next one Taylor!!

I'm so happy I finally got to see Taylor in Concert! We bought our tickets 15 months ago and it was definitely worth the wait! Her show was the best thing I've ever seen and I'm so sad that it's over! If I had the chance to go again I definitely will!!!

The show was perfect


Ticketmaster, do better because there were so many fans outside wanting to get in but couldn’t because of how hard it is to get tickets 🙄
The show was top notch, definitely one of my top shows !! Everything was so organized, show started right on time! Really was the night of our lives.

Best concert experience of all time ever—like ever!  

Taylor dazzled, entertained and included us in her artistry and magic for 3.5 hours.  She performed at a consistently superior level for the entire show. She spoke enough to let us know she cared about us and sang, played guitar and piano the rest of the time.  Awesomeness!

The eras tour was an experience of a lifetime!! I’ve never been to a concert like this one! Taylor puts on an amazing show singing some of her greatest hits. The outfits, choreography, and everything is just so perfectly executed.

Not only is Taylor a phenomenal song writer, but she performs each one with her heart and soul. This was my first concert ever and it is probably the best one I’ll ever experience. If I could go again and again I would 100% without a doubt do it.
A+ all around. Taylor puts on a perfect show from start to finish.

I can’t explain a Taylor swift concert! You just need to go!! I’ve been to many and no one else will ever be as good as her! The people there are just all so nice and friendly! Trading bracelets is so much fun! And dressing up feeling like the prettiest one there is amazing!! 🫶🏻

I can’t explain a Taylor swift concert! You just need to go!! I’ve been to many and no one else will ever be as good as her! The people there are just all so nice and friendly! Trading bracelets is so much fun! And dressing up feeling like the prettiest one there is amazing!! 🫶🏻

I went to Toronto N5, and long story short: It was the best night of my life. After years of listening to her music, this was my first time ever seeing Taylor live and I was not disappointed one bit (there was a 0% chance of an ounce of disappointment being in my body anyway). Toronto was totally in the Swiftie spirit and I loved it! It  made me even more excited to get into the stadium. Gracie opened for Taylor and she did AMAZING! My life was changed when I heard the Free Now bridge live. I hope to see Gracie in concert again! When Taylor came on I was full on sobbing. Who wouldn’t be? (Everyone around me…lol). I got to hear some of my childhood favourite songs live like Shake It Off and I Knew You Were Trouble, it was great! Taylor did such an amazing job performing and so did her dancers. I don’t even have words for just how much of an impressive performer she is. She performs for 3+ hours with insanely short breaks, it’s insane. Her stage is amazing, people aren’t lying when they say there isn’t a single bad seat at the Eras Tour. I was in section 527 and I saw EVERYTHING. I saw (and felt) the bad blood flames, the stage visuals, the flashing lights - everything. It was magical. I truly do hope to see Taylor in concert again the next time she decides to tour, I love her.

I have love Taylor Swift since I was a little kid, I was just 3 years old when her Debut album came out and I was hooked ever since I heard Tear Drops On My Guitar. I am 21 years old now and this was my first Taylor concert. I used to mourn that I never got to go to any of her concerts before but now I get to say I have been able to see every era that I thought I missed. I might sound dramatics but I don’t really care. This concert changed my life and I will remember it forever and ever!!!

Ticketmaster was easy to navigate with lots of communication about merchandise, ticket information, traffic, seating etc. 
Staff at the Roger’s Centre were friendly and eager to help. The queue to get in and merchandise moved quickly without issue. The concert itself was the trip of a lifetime and so worth the wait!
Show was absolutely amazing!! But tickets should be non-transferable!
Show was absolutely amazing!! But tickets should be non-transferable!

Absolutely incredible! I don’t think another concert will ever top the Eras Tour. The length, sets, vocals, and experience as a whole were one of a kind. My bf described it as a 3.5 hour Super Bowl worthy show because of how intense and amazing it was the whole time. Taylor is an extraordinary performer who truly thinks of every detail.

A truly incredible concert. Taylor is an incredible artist. The memories we made at the Eras tour will last a lifetime. Seeing my daughter’s eyes light up as her dreams came true was one of the best moments of my life.
No bad seats at the Eras Tour. What a performance, honestly felt so safe in the environment surrounded by Swifties. Her voice and theatrics was mind blowing, I couldn’t look away.

I am extremely fortunate to say this was my third (and final) time seeing the Eras Tour. 

It is magical from the time you arrive at the town it’s being held at to the time the concert is over and everyone is walking out. 

Taylor Swift, the dancers, the band and even the towns she plays in all create the most magical experience for everyone. Whether you’re a life long fan or just joining, whether you’re in the 500s or on the floor, you’ll have the absolute time of your life. 

Thank you all!

It was an asolutely breathtaking and amazing performance. Taylor killed it, her dancers killed it, her backup singers killed it, her band killed it, and the sound/tech crew killed it. Everyone involved killed it. I cried. Such a fun show and a fun environment. Everyone I traded bracelets with was lovely. The merch crew and concession sellers were so kind. The city itself did an excellent job (way to go Tayronto). Everything about this show blew me away and I loved it. Sucks that Ticketmaster handled the sale horribly, but luckily I was chosen. I hope all Canadian Swifties that didn't get to go to the Eras Tour get to go to her next tour.

Everything about this show was magical! From the moment we purchased tickets until the moment we left the Rogers Centre, everything went smoothly! It was stressful getting tickets in the first place because it was like winning the lottery to even get a pre-sale code but, once we had the tickets, we patiently waited over a year until it was time and WOW was it ever worth it! I would have waited a lifetime if I knew I’d get to see a show of that calibre. The whole production was seamless and, if there were any technical difficulties, we certainly couldn’t tell. Taylor Swift and her whole crew are total rockstars and work so professionally - we wouldn’t have been able to tell of anything went “wrong” because they perform with such strength and confidence, making everything look effortless! Every aspect of the show was captivating — her vocal performance and stage presence, their choreography, the stage set up and effects, the lighting/light show — even getting in and out of the Rogers Centre was a breeze! We were blown away by the bracelets given to every attendee that were somehow programmed to turn on a different points, in different rhythms and with various colours. The food and drinks available to purchase were a bit overpriced but delicious, and the price is to be expected at a stadium. The merchandise was cleverly set up in various sections of the building and, although lots of items were sold out, it was arranged in a way that ensured fans could at least see if there was anything they’d like to stand in line to get a chance to purchase. We had the time of our lives at this concert and don’t think anything will ever top it!

Attended the Friday 5th Eras show in Toronto at Rogers Centre. The show was amazing, Taylor was amazing as always (I’ve seen her 3x now). It was everything I was expecting and more. 
My only regret to say is I was sad about the merch lines. 2hr wait at 5pm and the show started at 6:45. Sadly I did not get anything.

I'm beyond disappointed. We purchased original tickets in A4, Row 24 which we believed to be premium seating near the stage. In reality I missed most of the show due to obstruction of the stage, watching the show from behind Taylor for most of the show. Was seated beside a tall person and had difficulty even watching the jumbo screen to see the show. I eventually just sat down, closed my eyes and listened. Taylors show was heavily supported by special lighting and details in the middle stage. Lesson learned. I'm now forever buying seats high in the stands and never want to have floor seating again. Please provide a description for seating when you sell it. Create a checklist of what you will see but also what you won't see. Sadly, I saw very little of the show.

Toronto night 5 Simply outstanding performance.  I have watched the movie many times, but being there in Rogers Center with Taylor and the production staff was something I will never forget. Out of all 75 concerts I have been to. This one is was the Best.  So glad my daughter suggested us to go.  Thank you Taylor for that amazing Experience

This was my daughters first concert and she still hasn't come down from the high of the night. GREATEST NIGHT EVER!

It was a night to remember. I’m so lucky to have been able to attend. Many fans wanted to attend and couldn’t. 
From the sets to Taylor’s showmanship it was as good as it gets. 
I hope it’s not too long before she tours again.
Not kidding when I say it was the best night of my life. The community, the friendship bracelet trading, the pure unadulterated joy. She’s created something so precious and so magical.
The best concert I’ve ever had. It feels like dream come true. Still not believe I just met Taylor for real. ILOVEUTAY!!

Taylor is an amazing entertainer!!! 
Getting tickets for the show is unbearable and stressful!!
Other than the jacked up resale price of the ticket, the concert was a magical experience!

Concert was great. Performance was amazing. We paid presale price for it and probably wouldn’t buy the ticket at resale price cause they’ve just gone out of hand. Our seats were good but view was a little obstructed by the vertical structure built that was meant to shoot out fire. 

Rogers centre seriously overpriced their food and drinks though it was insane.

The concert was absolutely amazing and Taylor was incredible. My issue lies with the VIP experience we got. We paid a fortune for VIP thinking we were going to get early access to the venue, our own merch booths, a VIP lounge/bar and we received none of these things, which did not make the price worth it at all. I would have purchased regular tickets had I known the rogers centre wouldn’t participate in any of the day of VIP perks. A bit disappointing for how expensive the tickets were.
What an EPIC night! Taylor came and conquered 🙌🏼. What energy and what a vibe! The Eras Tour was undoubtedly The BEST concert Ever!

This experience was everything that we needed after going through the pandemic and I always wanted to see her in concert and now I have for the first time I will always remember this moment for the rest of my whole life🥹🥲 my fave moment was singing my favourite songs from different eras such as red and folklore and the new album too was so amazing and I enjoyed the ending to the show too 🩷 i am gonna be honest waiting for a year for her to come to Toronto was the best wait ever and it was so worth it 🫶🏻❤️✨

What a fantastic show! So happy we were finally able to score face value tickets and go to the show. She performed for 3.5 hrs and was spectacular! I wish more people had the chance to get tickets to go.

What a fantastic show! So happy we were finally able to score face value tickets and go to the show. She performed for 3.5 hrs and was spectacular! I wish more people had the chance to get tickets to go.

What a show. Taylor brought it as always, amazing show and energy for 3.5 hours. Gracie Abrams was so good as well, a surprise. She was a delight. The crowd was absolutely incredible. So much energy, everyone was so nice and everyone was engaged and locked in on every song. The standing ovation was the loudest and longest I’ve ever heard. I think even Taylor was taken back. Toronto was a great experience and N5 was one of the best shows I’ve ever been to….this dad was a hero to an amazing 11 yo daughter o this night and she had the time of her life. Thank you Taylor (and Gracie) and thank you Toronto!

What a show. Taylor brought it as always, amazing show and energy for 3.5 hours. Gracie Abrams was so good as well, a surprise. She was a delight. The crowd was absolutely incredible. So much energy, everyone was so nice and everyone was engaged and locked in on every song. The standing ovation was the loudest and longest I’ve ever heard. I think even Taylor was taken back. Toronto was a great experience and N5 was one of the best shows I’ve ever been to….this dad was a hero to an amazing 11 yo daughter o this night and she had the time of her life. Thank you Taylor (and Gracie) and thank you Toronto!

The Eras Tour was absolutely incredible! Every aspect of it was the most magical experience! From showing up to the giant friendship bracelet on the building, exchanging friendship bracelets, and getting themed snacks to the performance. The show - there are no words! You can tell the work that everyone involved put in to make it the most amazing show ever! The light-up bracelets  and shouting lyrics brought the whole stadium together where it felt like 49,000 people were just one giant community. Large events in a city also have the potential for safety concerns but I felt 100% safe the whole time.

The Taylor Swift concert November 21/24 was the best concert of my life. Tremendously talented Taylor Swift put on an Amazing show. It was the experience of a lifetime.  My 13 year old daughter was overjoyed with the concert as well.
Thank you to everyone involved with this event.
Incredible! Worth the wait since I bought tickets Aug 2023! Sad to see the Eras your end (:
It was an Epic event of the lifetime. Great organization of the event. Seamless coordination. Kudos to all.

The show itself was AMAZING, no complaints regarding the performance Taylor put on. However, my friends and I bought the Karma is Boyfriend package and disappointed for the price is an understatement. As we travelled to the show from another province we felt the that the originally promised perks of crowdless merch lines and early entry into the stadium was worth it to ensure we got the merchandise we wanted.  However, come show day we did not receive any of the perks for vip tickets that were promised to be apart of the package at the time we purchased the tickets, nor were we informed of this change to the package OR refunded for removing these perks. We found out through research that these perks were actually no longer part of the package a week before our show. With the chaos of Toronto and early merch days we attempted to try and get merch early to guarantee we got what we wanted, however, this was not the case despite lining up early. We attempted the merch line 3 different days and still did not get the correct sizes we wanted as they had sold out within minutes. Part of this problem was the fact that there was no limit on how many items people could buy, so we saw multiple people walk out with multiples of the highly coveted blue crew necks and grey quarter zips. Another issue we encountered was the lack of organization when it came to entry into the stadium. We asked multiple workers where we should be standing in line and they had no clue and pointed us in a general direction. With this disorganized entry into the stadium, we ended up standing the wrong line for approximately an hour. As for the vip box that was supposed to be shipped to our house before the show did not arrive until after our show date I cannot speak to the quality of the merch in those boxes but can say that with the removed perks on show day in general the VIP karma is my boyfriend package was a waste of money and not worth it. Just another way to take advantage of and up charge swifties who want to see to see their favourite artist in person.

it was great i cried she sounded so good im sad it’s ending and im sad i wont be there for the rest of it I LOVE U TAYLOR

There is no better show than Taylor Swift’s Eras Tour. Over 3 hours of pure entertainment fueled by Taylor’s unparalleled talent that made me feel every possible emotion in a giant arena full of (mostly) women and girls that somehow felt like a giant collective hug. I don’t know that I’ll ever feel as safe, as carefree, or as hopeful as I felt in that space for that short but brilliant moment in time. I’m so glad and thankful to have had the opportunity and privilege to experience this epic masterpiece.

I have the best time as a fan of Taylor, 15 years waiting for it, worth it every single second. I got the code and bought a ticket on 515 section, row 16, the thing that I didn’t expected was to have a obstructed view and was NEVER said nothing about, besides, I paid a ticket price of a not obstructed view. The light/power tower as exactly in the middle of the diamond, so when Taylor was in the Center of the stage as impossible to see her. 
I just wanted to know before buy it and paid and price for a obstructed view, but the rest was 10/10. Is Taylor, she always do her best.

Where do i even start? From beginning to end Taylor Swift puts on a show! Even though we had seats we were on our feet the whole 3 hours! 🫶🏼
From the very start when the lights when down and the crowd erupted, I knew I would be part of something big. Thank you Taylor, for creating this experience.

Enchanting. Life changing. The eras tour is a night I will never forget. It was rare and I was there!! Ticketmaster needs to make the process easier for fans. I was one of the lucky few who won the Great War, but so many Canadian fans missed out. The prices were insane- especially the resale prices. Do better next time ticket master!

Lovers and haters can’t deny Taylor is a superstar! Kept the audience of 40000 people entertained for 3.5 with surprises songs and even a surprise light up wrist band! Wardrobe changes, set changes oh my!
The show was great, but the seats are incredibly tiny, with no room for a tall person legs. Only terrible beer options for premium prices.

While I was getting concerned with the growing amount of emails from Ticketmaster regarding the Toronto performance of Taylor Swift, I was incredibly impressed with the organization of the ENTIRE event.  I did not stand in line (though I didn't dare to for merchandise), and all of the security members and volunteers were extremely helpful and nice (a nice change).  I was impressed at the level of local businesses who made and traded bracelets, and how easy it was through the process of getting to our seats.
I was not impressed however at the small drink (Cutwater can of Tequila/Soda).  3 drinks for 3 of us was $76.  That is over $25 each for a $3 LCBO small can.  That was an extreme overcharge, and because they open it immediately, you can't decline it!

We were lucky enough to score some tickets to night 5 of The Eras Tour in Toronto last week.  From start to finish, the event was first class.  Very well organized entry, and everything felt very safe.  The concert itself was amazing!  I'm not the target demographic for TS, however I had a great time watching my young daughter have the time of her life along with tens of thousands of others.  The entire production was flawless and the atmosphere electric for the full duration of the show.  Incredible performer - she deserves everything she gets!  My only complaint was the merch lines and the costing on the concessions.  To be expected I guess, but at an over 800% markup, it becomes a bit much.  The overall cost for attending live events has become unattainable for many.  I feel very fortunate that we could afford it.  Overall - an incredible show and I look forward to her next big tour. I hope she keeps a similar tour as it was really cool for the tour dates to end in Canada!

I have seen every tour since Fearless. Taylor has always put on an absolute production. But The Eras Tour ??? It’s art. Everything about it is so magical. It was such an emotional experience going back in time. Picturing Taylor on the Fearless Tour —> to now. I bawled. I got to experience this with my family, including my daughter (this was her first Taylor show). I can’t believe there are only 3 shows left. We’ve all been following this for over a year … What will we all do after this??? Thank you Taylor / Taylor Nation for making this sooooo beautiful for everyone. I will miss the traditions & I’ll never stop trading bracelets. 13 stars from this geriatric fan! 🤍

Standing sections like the balconies could have used stage boxes so people could see above the people that were glued to the railing. They were shoulder to shoulder so it was hard to even see in between them. I understand that it was classified as obstructed view but having a line of boxes about a foot high to stand on would have allowed everyone to see; not just those who got to the railing first.

From the moment the lights dimmed and Taylor appeared on stage, I knew this wasn’t just a concert—it was a journey through the soundtrack of my life. The Eras Tour was everything I hoped for and so much more.

Hearing “State of Grace” as one of the surprise songs was like stepping back in time to a moment of pure nostalgia and hope. Her voice carried me through waves of emotion, and I couldn’t help but cry, feeling the weight of her lyrics all over again. When she sang “Labyrinth,” it felt as though time stopped. The vulnerability and beauty in that performance left me completely undone.

Throughout the night, I laughed, I cried, and I sang my heart out. Taylor’s ability to connect with an entire stadium full of people is nothing short of magical. Her storytelling, the visuals, the energy—it was a once-in-a-lifetime experience that I will treasure forever.

If you ever have the chance to see her live, do it. This wasn’t just a concert; it was a celebration of artistry, resilience, and the power of music to bring us together. Thank you, Taylor, for giving us a night we’ll carry with us always.
Phenomenahal show with fabulous opening act Gracie Abraham. The show was 3 h non step with perfect transitions between albums. Taylor and team were graceful and truly care about fans! Loved it!

I don’t know how she does that for 3 hours straight. She’s Wonder Woman. Thank you Taylor for an unforgettable night!!!
Everything went so smoothly from getting to he venue on the Go , getting in the Roger’s Center to our seats was easy! The show was the best I have ever seen! I love Taylor Swift!
She played for 3 1/2 hours. You can feel all the love in the stadium. Just incredible!
She played for 3 1/2 hours. You can feel all the love in the stadium. Just incredible!

The concert itself was hands down one of the best productions I’ve ever seen. The attention to detail and end product was extremely impressive. 
However the system to acquire the tickets was a hassle and that hassle has transferred to every ticketmaster show I’ve attended. Someone must be done regarding the resale market and dynamic pricing must be abolished. Its taking away the ability for the everyday fan to attend and enjoy their favorite artists, and reflects on the selfishness and greed of Ticketmaster and the artists that allow this to happen.
The best concert i have been to. The total vibe, the light show, the entire production was phenomenal.  Can't wait for the next.

The show was absolutely AMAZING! Loved every second of it!!! Would have gone to every single show she had in Toronto if I could have!!! I have seen her 2 other times during her past tours and always had a great time! 
Presale merch was a bit of a mess with the amount of resellers and the no limits on purchases until the second last day. Resellers were buying hot items and selling for 2-3 times the price causing the venue to run out of hot items within 10 min of opening, while true fans had waited in lines for hours.   
 However, the ticketmaster war and resale of tickets was outrageous and poorly done!! Very disappointed in the mess that was!

I understand the hype! From the moment she took the stage to her last song of the night, Taylor was on point. The energy of the crowd, the lights and the effects, created an experience that's hard to even put into words. My daughter and I loved every minute

What an amazing show! I'd watch it every night if I could. I just wish that it's easier for fans to access the tickets. However, all the effort was worth it. I've never been that happy in my life and I've never screamed that much! What a magical, sparkly, and enchanting night!

This was by far the best concert I have been to in a long time!  I took my 9 yr old son for his birthday and he said that was the best moment in his life!  Thank you Taylor for giving us the best memories!

The concert as absolutely amazing and once I was finally able to grab a pair of tickets from ticket master the tickets were easy to use with no problems. The concert its self was the best show I have ever seen in my life. I do wish ticket master would alter their purchasing practices to further reduce the resold tickets at gross costs. It’s a shame when fan tickets end up in the hands of people just wanting to make money…treat tickets like plane tickets with names and id

It was one of the best night of my life. Her performance, the energy and effort put into was out of this world. I have always been a fan of taylor swift since I was eight, and I am grateful for ticketmaster or whoever selected me to get a presale tickets just to see her along with my younger sibling. Thank you so much!

We really LOVED the concert and Taylor!  The whole thing was incredible.  Everything was so expensive though- 2 tickets $340, 2 meals(chicken tenders and tater tots) $78, 1 sweatshirt and 1 t-shirt $192!  Crazy expensive for one night!

I’ve been a die hard swiftie for as long as I can remember. The Eras Tour is a class act. Taylor knows how to keep an audience engaged for 3.5 hours. The songs are just so nostalgic and meaningful. She sang with purpose and intent the whole night. One of the best nights of my life but hands down the best concert I have ever been to. I will forever be a fan of Taylor Alison Swift.

Taylor is absolutely amazing !!!

TICKETMASTER should not let tickets be resold!   Not fair.  All that got a code should have been able to purchase tickets- why give so many codes ?!  And EVERYONE should have been able to get into the queue during the two weeks of the shows  


Merch - well not ticket master issue but again- LIMIT what one can buy!!

Epic show, merch lines were completely ridiculous and you were left with nothing but not sure how to avoid that. Food and drink prices way too high, $10 for a bottle of water, that’s robbery, can’t even afford to stay hydrated.

The Eras Tour is the BEST concert of all time. Taylor has set the bar high and I don't think anybody can do what she does. I became a fan because of my husband, and I totally get it now how crazy swifties are over her. You get the best value for your buck for this concert. This was my 4th show and the last. I hope she doesn't wait too long to have another concert.

Show was marvelous! You certainly get your moneys worth. 3 hr 45 minutes.
Artistry and lighting was wonderful! Made the show all that much better. 10/10 experience. Venue wasn't great. Way too crowded which made it very uncomfortable. Seats were way too small. Halls selling merchandise and drinks/food was overrun with people. Long, long line to use the facilities. Should have been held at larger venue.

The Era’s Tour in Toronto was epic.  Taylor Swift is an amazing song writer, singer and performer.  The atmosphere at the concert was like no other.  It was so worth waiting for. My daughter had the time of her life!
To say I got to be at an Eras Tour show will be one of my greatest memories to share. Experiencing this with my daughter is something we will both cherish forever. Taylor you are AMAZING!
Best concert. Didn’t even feel like 3.5hrs. She is amazing. You’d think she could go on for 6hrs the energy she has. So captivating.

Amazing!! Just Amazing!! Although, I bought resale..wasn’t one of the lucky verified fans that got a code.  Been trying for 2 years to get reasonably priced tickets or even access to buy tickets. Ticketmaster you have to do better. Your verified fan system is not working.
This was an amazing show, the performance was amazing, the environment was great and we really enjoyed!

The Eras tour in Toronto was world class. The communication on which gate we were to go to, what corner of the stadium the gate was located at, how to scan your ticket was excellent. The police presence to handle the crowds and block roads made it very efficient to navigate our way to the event from public transport. The concert of course… was amazing!!!! Well done Toronto!
The concert experience was everything we wanted, and the set up and organizing at the Roger’s Centre made it possible to enjoy it without any hassle.

A magical magical experience, I've never felt more safe and secure in my life! I managed to get swept up in the music. Everyone from stadium staff (cleaning and security) to Taylor herself were amazing 🫶🏻🩷

Attending Taylor Swift’s Eras Tour was nothing short of magical! From start to finish, the entire experience was perfectly orchestrated. Ticketmaster made the process seamless, and the anticipation leading up to the event only added to the excitement.

Taylor’s performance was absolutely phenomenal. Her stage presence, vocals, and the stunning visuals made every moment unforgettable. Each era came to life with its own unique charm, taking us on a nostalgic journey through her musical evolution. The energy in the crowd was electric, and you could feel the love and connection Taylor shares with her fans.

The venue was well-organized, with clear signage and helpful staff. Entry was smooth, and the sound quality was impeccable throughout the night. I especially appreciated how Ticketmaster kept us updated on event details leading up to the show, which made planning so much easier.

This was truly a once-in-a-lifetime experience, and I’m so grateful to Ticketmaster for helping make it happen. Thank you for bringing us closer to an artist who means so much to so many. I’ll cherish this night forever!

This was more than just a concert it was a full Taylor Swift experience. It was the best and most magical day of my entire life and I feel so lucky to have been able to go. I will hold onto the memories from this day for the rest of my life. Seeing my favourite singer and role model who I have been a fan of since I was 5 singing picture to burn was a full circle moment and nothing will ever compare. It was a bonding experience with my three sisters that I will cherish forever. Thank you Taylor for everything 🫶🏻

Taylor Swift was absolutely incredible. She played 45 songs, 3.5 hours of pure joy🫶

I saw Morgan wallen at Lucas oil and the music quality was eh. I was nervous for Taylor bc I read online that the acoustics weren’t great to performers in there - but Taylor was amazing!! I was in the nose bleeds and still had an amazing experience. The show started on time and it was so amazing and worth the money! Best concert ever!

First of all, this was my first concert experience outside my home country. And Ive to say it was a delightful experience which was not due to Taylor but the love and charm spread by swifties. I am not a Else, musicwise the listening experience wasn’t the same as what you listen on her videos or spotify. Her voice was kinda male dominated at times but the background singers and dancers makes it all at a different level. My seat was on ground floor, so couldn’t see the stage and bridge light effects, but it was worth it since I could see Taylor from nearby. No matter where you sit, you’ll always be able to see the screen . Having said that, I am not a huge swiftie who knows all of her songs, so was not being able to get along in whole concert. Maybe that’s why i’ve given 4 stars. But definitely was a mind blowing experience! Management of event was good, staff was welcoming.Security measures could be improved.

It was such a wonderful and memorable concert! Taylor Swift was amazing! Taylor Swift and Gracie Abrams are both such great live singers and performers! The line-up was also quick and efficient considering the major crowd of people at the concert. Overall, it was a great event - thank you to everyone who made it happen!

I was ready for it. It's been a long time coming! I counted days, I counted miles, to see her there. It was rare I was there I remember it all too well. I don't know how it gets better than this! This night was sparkling and flawless! Taylor was the loudest woman this city had ever see, and the crowds went wild! This happens once every few lifetimes so in this moment now, capture it, remember it, hold on to the memories they will hold on to you. Confetti falls to the ground may these memories break our fall, there's glitter on the floor after the party, I had the time of my life with Taylor and Gracie!

PROS
At 68, I have never experienced a concert as inspirational as this one in my lifetime & will never probably have an opportunity to do it again.  Thank you, Taylor…

Taylor, was the opening act at a Brad Paisley, concert I attended many years ago.  I still remember her performance, a tiny girl in large cowboy boots singing her Tim McGrath, song.  Taylor, stole my heart that evening.

In honesty I did not closely follow Taylor’s music when she switched to pop as it targeted a younger audience, but I would continue to listen to Taylor’s music by chance & follow TV award shows.  I thought what an amazing young woman, a smart business woman, thriving in a challenging world; & thinking how proud her parents must feel to have raised such an incredible person.

Unfortunately Taylor’s life appeared to be an open book & she grew up with all eyes on her so it is obvious her success did not come without heartache and pain along the way… way to go Taylor, for just being yourself through it all, may you enjoy much happiness in your future!  

You have acquired an “older” new fan who will pay closer attention as you continue to follow your heart and dreams wherever they take you.  

For myself Taylor’s concert was an experience  
to make memories with my grandsons.   A once in a lifetime experience to make lifetime memories. Life can be unfair at times, and everyone has a story, this story will bring good memories that can be shared for generations to come.

They will remember the impact this eras tour of Taylor’s had not just on our lives but the lives of so many.
 
My first travel post COVID and it was amazing to truly feel like I stepped out from my bubble back home.  An  opportunity to escape life’s woes for a brief time, turn off all external noise and focus on some positive in life.  If only for a short time a door was unlocked and shared with loved ones.  Again, thank you “Taylor”

After standing for hours outside the CN Tower and Rogers Stadium in Toronto for two days I gained much knowledge & insight.  The atmosphere was filled with happiness, love and much excitement from all walks of life.    One big family reunion enjoyed by all.  Fans were singing their hearts out without missing a beat, word for word as if it were gospel.

They came from far and wide, all shapes and sizes, different nationalities, religions & cultures all with a magical connection to Taylor Swift.

They liked what they liked, and they clearly expressed all of Taylor’s music & life in their appearance.  Fans “Swifties” were dressed to demonstrate the various albums/eras of her life.  The thought, time and care fans placed on replicating Taylor’s style was really something to witness.  There was “sparkle” and “glitter” everywhere young and old alike, even many fan pets came outfitted in Taylor fashion!

The friendship bracelet frenzy, friends trading and sharing bracelets at every opportunity and exchanging stories.  

For an old gal I learned so much on this experience.  I found myself imagining what kind of world we could live in if only we could spread this Taylor phenomenon like a virus?  WOW just WOW!

CONS 
None.  Observations…
The safety & security in & around Toronto & at the venue was clearly evident and much appreciated.

Entry into the stadium, was efficient and swift but once inside much confusion existed among staff.  In particular crowd direction and lines for merchandise sadly lacked.  Fans were repeatedly redirected causing some frustration to fans.  It was obvious the demand exceeded expectations and after hours of waiting in line, one was hard pressed to find availability of selection and size.  This apparently was the same with pre sale of merchandise; surely this is something that needs revision and consideration for future events similar in nature. 

This held true for all food and washroom access which for the most part fans were prepared for these challenges and happily accepted any inconvenience.

All & all most fans & workers alike remained respectful based solely on my observations.

My Ticketmaster experience was a first & although uncomfortable with such online transactions it went well.  Unfortunately that was not the case for many concert goers seeking tickets for this event.  That leaves something to be said for online ticket acquisition for events at major venues.  Corporate ticket options serve a purpose but do not reach the broader fan base in most instances.  Although not cost effective these days there is something to be said for a portion of ticket supply available for purchase at venues. 

Floor seating/standing does not accommodate a shorter audience.  Safety built flooring on an elevation could easily resolve oversight otherwise floor tickets should indicate view obstruction as applicable to other venue seating when view obstruction is a possibility.

I took my daughter to the concert and I'm more of a country music fan but TS is a real entertainer! She was engaging to the crowd. She covered a wide variety of music. The concert was over 3 hours long, not including the warm up act. The last time I was in an environment with fans that loud was at a play off game. They sold out of the blue crew neck so go early if you want that. Overall a great concert, it might ruin other concerts for me in the future.
